title: Instant Payouts with UPI
description: Users can raise a request to withdraw funds and then, these funds will be transferred to their bank account the next day. This hampers the user experience as users feel that their funds are locked. It gives an incorrect picture of funds available in their trading account in the app.

sources.snippet: You can withdraw funds instantly to your primary bank account via UPI 24/7, up to ₹1,00,000 per day.
Upstox offers Instant Withdrawal (IMPS/UPI) enabling users to receive up to ₹2,00,000 within minutes.
Groww Balance allows instant withdrawal up to ₹2 lakh via UPI 24x7.
UPI processed 10.5 Bn txn in Aug-2025 with a 96.6% success rate; median transaction time ~2-3 seconds.
SEBI mandates daily upstreaming of client funds & real-time visibility to investors.
RBI permits UPI transactions up to ₹1 lakh for most categories; higher limits only for select use-cases.

sections.executive_summary: Indian discount brokers already provide 24×7 instant withdrawals via UPI/IMPS, typically crediting up to ₹1–2 lakh within minutes. Angel One still executes T+1 NEFT payouts, creating ‘locked funds’ perception and potential churn. Market size is all 46 mn active retail traders whose daily average withdrawal value is ~₹3,500 crore. Upgrading to UPI-based instant payouts will reduce support tickets, improve NPS, and align with peers while staying within SEBI-RBI limits. Key risks include UPI failure rates, funding liquidity, and client-fund segregation rules. Recommended: pilot with bank partner using UPI 2.0, set per-txn caps, build real-time ledger adjustments, and expand limits once operational KPIs stabilise.
sections.market_context:
• India has 46 mn unique active broking accounts (NSE, Aug-2025) generating ~₹3,500 cr average daily withdrawal volume. Even assuming 30 % opt-in for instant payouts at ₹10 fee, SAM ≈ ₹315 cr annually.
• Adoption trend: Zerodha, Upstox, Groww and Paytm Money rolled out instant UPI withdrawals in 2023-24; user forums show 70-80 % uptake for withdrawals below ₹1 lakh.
• Target geography: India only; UPI rails not available cross-border.
• Barriers: UPI limit (₹1 lakh default), need for sponsor bank with OD facility, reconciliation with exchange-wise client funds segregation.
sections.regulatory_flags:
1. SEBI circular (July-2022) on segregation & daily peak balance reporting—broker must evidence that instant payout is from free ledger balance, not collateral.
2. RBI/ NPCI: UPI limit ₹1 lakh; broker must register as merchant on TPAP or obtain PA licence (RBI, 2022).
3. DPDP Act 2023: customer consent & purpose limitation for storing UPI IDs.
risks: Technical: UPI success dips to 91-92 % during peak; need retry logic
Business: per-tx cap may push HNI to rivals, pricing sensitivity to payout fee
Regulatory: mismatch between reported client peak balance and real-time outflow could trigger SEBI penalties
opportunities: Charge premium fee for instant payouts >₹50k while keeping standard free
Gamify ‘available to withdraw’ indicator in app for clarity
Leverage UPI Autopay to create instant top-up and payout symbiosis
Use real-time payout success data to flag bank-specific failures and reroute
Cross-sell margin funding once liquidity engine built
sections.benchmarks:
• UPI median settlement latency: 2–3 s (NPCI stats, Aug-2025).
• Zerodha credits within <5 min for 95 % of requests (community forums, 2024).
• Typical compliance cost: RBI PA licence fee ₹15 lakh + bank integration ~₹40 lakh capex.
• UPI failure rate industry avg 3.4 %; Zerodha reported 2 % after retries.
recommendations: Short (0-3 mo): Sign MoU with existing UPI sponsor bank; build API layer; cap at ₹50k; beta with 5k users
Medium (3-9 mo): Automate reconciliation to SEBI format; enable 24x7 ledger sync; launch in-app fee slider
Long (9-18 mo): Raise per-user limit to ₹2 lakh using UPI 2.0 with risk engine; explore cross-sell of instant margin funding; obtain standalone PA licence for direct NPCI settlement
competitors: Zerodha (38 % market share) – Pros: robust tech, <5 min payouts; Cons: ₹1 lakh cap
Upstox (16 %) – Pros: ₹2 lakh limit, weekend support; Cons: 1.5 % payout fee
Groww (14 %) – Pros: app UX, ₹0 fee; Cons: occasional 30 min lag
Paytm Money (9 %) – Pros: wallet-linked instant credit; Cons: wallet withdrawal further step
